<div>\n  <div>\n   DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   More information can be found at www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>What you’ll do<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Our Manufacturing team is the heart of our business. As a Senior Production Operator, you’ll be a key part of our diverse workforce and work a rotating 12-hour shift pattern 7-7, with 7-day breaks, to support the plant’s day-to-day operations.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key Areas of Responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Operates and monitors equipment and process to produce quality chemical intermediates and finished products to a pre-determined operations plan.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs material handling , Fork lift operation., Weighing and dispensing of raw materials.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operates storage, blending, milling and packaging equipment to prepare and transfer materials to production through to finished goods inventory.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Complies with cGMP, ICHQ-7 and ISO regulations and procedures for packaging, handling and storage of incoming, in-process and finished goods.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Assists Technical Coordinator with coordinating and prioritizing maintenance needs with production needs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs general housekeeping\u002Fmaintenance of process areas (e.g., painting, cleaning, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs the principles of Manufacturing Excellence (Manufex) environment, (e.g., minor equipment repair).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Involvement in setting up and reviewing site SHE requirements, procedures, and instructions by participating in SHE culture on site.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>The opportunity to grow your career in a supportive, friendly team environment<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Paid overtime opportunities so you can build the week you want<\u002Fli> \n   <li>18 days of paid time off and 3 floating holiday.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Competitive Salary<\u002Fli> \n   <li>An immediate sign on bonus of $2,500<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Medical, Dental, Vision, and Gym benefits – which all start on day one<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Employee Assistance Program<\u002Fli> \n   <li>401K Match<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Life insurance<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Diverse employees who aren’t afraid to think outside of the box<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A team that truly cares about sustainability, each other and our customers<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A complete commitment to ethics and integrity<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The chance to be part of a team that feels more like friends than colleagues<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. As a strategic partner with an approach driven not only by market dynamics but by the unique needs of every customer, DSM Biomedical brings an unparalleled breadth of product portfolios, proprietary manufacturing and processing capabilities, world-class IP, and extensive regulatory experience and expertise. El propósito de DSM es crear vidas más brillantes para todos. DSM afronta con sus productos y soluciones algunos de los retos mundiales actuales más importantes, a la vez que logra prosperidad económica y valor medioambiental y social para todas las partes interesadas (clientes, empleados, accionistas y la sociedad en general). DSM ofrece soluciones innovadoras para la nutrición humana y animal, higiene personal y fragancias, productos sanitarios, productos ecológicos y aplicaciones, y nueva movilidad y conectividad. DSM y sus empresas asociadas arrojan un volumen de ventas netas anual de aproximadamente 10 000 millones de euros y cuentan con unos 23.000 empleados. La empresa se fundó en 1902 y cotiza en Euronext Ámsterdam. Más información en www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <p><b>Objetivo del puesto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Proceso de Importación y Exportación virtual y definitiva del negocio DEM México.\n   <br> Asegurar el cumplimiento de las fechas de entrega de los materiales y Garantizar que los documentos este ordenados y correctos y compartido con las áreas necesarias, hacer seguimiento con DEP USA de las ordenes para clientes.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>Responsabilidades:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li><p>Hacer seguimiento de las órdenes para llegar virtual en México con DEP USA;<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Hacer seguimiento del certificado IMMEX;<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Controlar los pedimientos mensuales;<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Verificar los costos con la operación mensual;<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Hacer seguimiento del inventario con Reys;<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Estar actualizada con las actividades como Customer Service back up de USA;<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Acompañar con el agente aduanal la documentación de cada embarque y costeo;<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>Participar de Projetos de mejorias;<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Acompañar los costos de cada embarque.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>La Compensación:<\u002Fb>\n   <br> Trabajar para DSM significa una oportunidad de contribuir realmente a mejorar la vida de las personas resolviendo los retos presentes en el mundo de hoy. Trabajos desafiantes, oportunidades de crecimiento y un ambiente inspirador permiten que puedas alcanzar tu desarrollo personal. DSM reconoce que el éxito continuo de una compañía depende del desarrollo frecuente y compromiso de nuestros colaboradores buscando una política de remuneración justa y competitiva, reconociendo las competencias y desempeño individual y del equipo.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Procedimiento y Contacto:<\u002Fb>\n   <br> ¿Estas interesado en esta posición por favor aplica en linea enviandonos tu CV y Carta de presentación a través del portal de carreras (www.dsm.com\u002Fcareers). <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Identify opportunities for process improvement, waste removal, and cost reduction.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Plan and facilitate continuous improvement events using Lean Six Brighter Living.™DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   More information can be found at www.dsm.com\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <b>What You’ll Do<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   We are looking for a highly motivated person to become part of Yokohama QC laboratory of DSM Japan KK and strengthen the team with expertise in Analytical Chemistry.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your key responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Perform routine analyses of DSM products according to Japanese official specifications for pharma, cosmetics and foods and report in time<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Document all activities according to good manufacturing practice (GMP) to comply with Japanese pharma regulations<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participate in the development of new and improvement of existing testing methods<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Answer customer requests and give advice in product quality, testing methods and interpretation of reports<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Actively share ideas on possible process improvements<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>University degree in natural sciences such as chemistry, pharmacy<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Broad knowledge of different analytical techniques, including HPLC <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Native speaker of Japanese, intermediate level in English (at least analytical science)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Basic computer skills in Microsoft Office, especially Word, Outlook and Excel<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About Yokohama QC of DSM Japan KK<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   DSM Japan, a group company of DSM Nutritional Products, imports and provides DSM products to Japanese customers. DSM Japan has its own laboratory at Yokohama, Japan, where the lab carries out quality control of products for Japanese customers in compliance with the Japanese Pharmacopeia and the Japanese Food Additive Specifications.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. <div>\n  <div>\n   DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   More information can be found at www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <b>What you’ll do:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Responsible for producing quality chemical intermediates and finished products according to a pre-determined operations plan.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Operations of process equipment in accordance with Key Performance Measures, Current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMPs), Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), safety\u002Fregulatory requirements, and divisional goals.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your Key Responsibilities:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Operates and monitors equipment and processes to produce quality chemical intermediates and finished products to a pre-determined operations plan<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Obtains and inspects finished\u002Fin-process product and performs sampling and testing as required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs material handling, general housekeeping, Weighing and dispensing of raw materials<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Performs the principles of Manufacturing Excellence (Manufex) environment, (e.g., minor equipment repair).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Maintains process and equipment documentation for tracking overall effectiveness .<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensures process lines are grounded during transfer of materials.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completes safety equipment checklists and ensures safety equipment is properly located and functional.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Attends formal training classes (e.g., safety, quality improvement, problem solving, MSDS, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Completes all required computer-based training modules.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Acts in such a way that safety awareness &amp; Systems to include lighting, HVAC, production wastewater system, steam, compressed air, hot and cold-water systems, electrical, and all similar systems located throughout the facilities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Effectively utilize and maintain the SAP Plan Maintenance System, including following all computer based and paper processes for work order completion and documentation. (Manufex ME04)<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Lead and\u002For participate with root cause analysis for operating problems including the identification of contributing causes for non-operating events and work to eliminate the cause for continuous improvement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Closely integrate with the manufacturing team to provide accurate, concise, and professional updates as to important repair steps taken, parts ordered, and time estimated until completion.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Support projects as required to remove, install and make operational equipment to aid in debottlenecking operations by addressing upcoming production’s needs and proactively resolving issues.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Rotating on-call responsibilities<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n manufacturing environment, troubleshooting and repairing all types of industrial processes: mechanical, electrical, instrumentation, hydraulic, and pneumatic, is required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Basic knowledge of boiler plant fundamentals and operation.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>PLC\u002FAutomation, TIG welding experience, refrigeration, HVAC and Boiler Operators License is preferred.<\u002Fli>\n productivity and yield enhancement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>At least one year production or food service experience preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM es una empresa global, “purpose-led”, con base científica y activa en los campos de la nutrición, la salud y la vida sostenible. El propósito de DSM es crear vidas más brillantes para todos. DSM afronta con sus productos y soluciones algunos de los retos mundiales actuales más importantes, a la vez que logra prosperidad económica y valor medioambiental y social para todas las partes interesadas (clientes, empleados, accionistas y la sociedad en general). DSM ofrece soluciones innovadoras para la nutrición humana y animal, higiene personal y fragancias, productos sanitarios, productos ecológicos y aplicaciones, y nueva movilidad y conectividad. DSM y sus empresas asociadas arrojan un volumen de ventas netas anual de aproximadamente 10 000 millones de euros y cuentan con unos 23.000 empleados. La empresa se fundó en 1902 y cotiza en Euronext Ámsterdam. Más información en www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <p><b>Analista de Procesos de mejora continua<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El reto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Revisar, optimizar y transformar los procesos en el área de producción, optimizando los recursos para la fabricación de los productos, manteniendo las instalaciones y procesos seguros (SHE) que garanticen la producción, así como la verificación y análisis de los resultados de cada área para mantener el flujo de información de manera oportuna hacia nuestros clientes y planta, de acuerdo con las políticas, procedimientos y normas de calidad establecidas.\n   <br> El Analista de Procesos debe revisar y mejorar los procesos en el área de producción con el enfoque de mejorar, actualizar y estandarizar las actividades realizadas en planta HNC, finalmente debe de fomentar la mejora continua y respetar los estándares de SHE y Calidad\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La posición:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Optimizar y administrar los recursos y materiales físicos disponibles del área de producción, requisitando y apoyando el mantenimiento oportuno, para de esta forma minimizar paros y deterioros de los equipos e instalaciones.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Desarrollar al personal de producción, basado en la detección de necesidades de capacitación, estableciendo programas de entrenamiento interno y externo, así como la asignación de nuevas responsabilidades, para de esta forma mantener un recurso humano preparado y motivado que aporte valor al incremento de la productividad y el servicio hacia nuestros clientes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proporcionar información oportuna y efectiva del área de producción a gerencia de planta HNC, elaborando reportes electrónicos, basados en el análisis de la información generada aportando valor en la toma de decisiones efectiva.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Desarrollar, apoyar y dar seguimiento a los planes de mejora de nuestros clientes a través de visitas a sus plantas, optimizando sus procesos productivos, así como el monitoreo del abastecimiento de nuestros productos para lograr un desarrollo en conjunto, fomentando la imagen de servicio de la planta a nuestros clientes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinar y apoyar las actividades de seguridad, higiene y protección ambiental de acuerdo con las políticas y procedimientos respectivos, con capacitación y acciones de entrenamiento, para dar seguridad efectiva al personal minimizando riesgos para la compañía.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinar con recursos humanos los planes de capacitación y adiestramiento al personal, a través de la detección de necesidades de capacitación, conductas y habilidades para mejorar el ambiente de trabajo, su seguridad y la superación personal para garantizar el desarrollo y bienestar del personal.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Analizar e implementar mejoras en los procesos de producción y sistemas administrativos, mediante el estudio y análisis estadístico para apoyar la toma de decisiones eficaz.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Colaborar en la oportuna resolución de los problemas con el plan de producción.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Colaborar en la administración correcta de los datos maestros de producción.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Colaborar en las implementaciones de los sistemas de calidad, ISO, GMP´s, HACCP, SHE y Lean para el área de producción.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinar, planear, evaluar y proponer en conjunto con gerencia de planta las mejores alternativas para el envió de los pedidos de los clientes a fabricar en las plantas terceros, manteniendo los estándares de calidad, seguridad y servicio hacia nuestros clientes, obteniendo una mejor productividad y rentabilidad de la compañía.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Crear una notificación de trabajo cuando se detecte un problema de mantenimiento.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Revisar la notificación de trabajo de mantenimiento, y entregar al departamento responsable.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El ideal:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Estudios profesionales concluidos en Ingenieria Industrial, Alimentos, Quimica o afín<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conocimientos de Lean Manufacturing<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experiencia en gestión de proyectos de mejora continua<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Inglés intermedio<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manejo de excel avanzado<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La Compensación:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Trabajar para DSM significa una oportunidad de contribuir realmente a mejorar la vida de las personas resolviendo los retos presentes en el mundo de hoy. Trabajos desafiantes, oportunidades de crecimiento y un ambiente inspirador permiten que puedas alcanzar tu desarrollo personal. DSM reconoce que el éxito continuo de una compañía depende del desarrollo frecuente y compromiso de nuestros colaboradores buscando una política de remuneración justa y competitiva, reconociendo las You help set the vision for the region and actively execute the strategy. You will report to the DSM Region Lead for Safety Health, Environment &amp; Security, with functional reporting to the DSM Global Lead Functional Safety – SIS.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key Responsibilties:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Ensure that specific functional safety knowledge and expertise in the region is kept up to date and in compliance with international standards and DSM requirements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensure integration of functional Safety knowledge in other competences and networks, such as Process Safety Network TIER2, Maintenance Network and others.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Perform design &amp; field verifications for functional safety applications, authorizing non-standard functional safety\u002FSIS solutions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Perform functional safety \u002F SIS audits and ensure that deficiencies found are translated into corrective actions, monitor the execution of the corrective actions, and escalate to the appropriate management level, if and where required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Specify and\u002For conduct safety re-design, allocation, verification and validation of instrumented safety provisions. Use combination of judgment and skill to determine appropriateness of application for safety integrity.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Functional knowledge applying IEC61511-1 and ANSI ISA-84.00.01-2004 standards in a manufacturing environment as it relates to the process safety life cycle.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interface with corporate technical\u002Fcontent experts to ensure uniform delivery of the process safety standard. Influence operational line management with results, recommendations, and solutions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Train plant and other personnel in technical requirements to further build up the instrumented process safety competency including achieving black belt status and helping others achieve the same.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Lead or participate in cross-functional teams in developing and implementing improvements in standards or ways of working.<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Participate and contribute to the continuous improvement of the company’s performance and growth as organization.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Collaborate with external experts\u002Fconsultants in achieving desired outcomes.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A competitive compensation package, with comprehensive health and welfare benefits.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A place to grow and develop.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A company that is purpose-led and performance-driven in a corporate culture that values people and planet.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The opportunity to work on growing brands and build on a strong foundation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The chance to make improvements and make an impact on the business.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>B.S. Degree in Automation\u002FComputer\u002FElectrical Engineering or similar discipline involving process control. Master’s degree desirable.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5-7 years of process control and safety instrumented systems experience in a manufacturing setting with progressively increasing responsibility.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent analytical and reasoning skills. High sensitivity to safety risks and good judge of translating those risk to practical solutions to achieve the right risk management balance. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Strong communication and engagement skills both to leadership and shop floor. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM es una empresa global, “purpose-led”, con base científica y activa en los campos de la nutrición, la salud y la vida sostenible. El propósito de DSM es crear vidas más brillantes para todos. DSM afronta con sus productos y soluciones algunos de los retos mundiales actuales más importantes, a la vez que logra prosperidad económica y valor medioambiental y social para todas las partes interesadas (clientes, empleados, accionistas y la sociedad en general). DSM ofrece soluciones innovadoras para la nutrición humana y animal, higiene personal y fragancias, productos sanitarios, productos ecológicos y aplicaciones, y nueva movilidad y conectividad. DSM y sus empresas asociadas arrojan un volumen de ventas netas anual de aproximadamente 10 000 millones de euros y cuentan con unos 23.000 empleados. La empresa se fundó en 1902 y cotiza en Euronext Ámsterdam. Más información en www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <p><b>Controller Financiero<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La posición:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Asegurar la entrega y ejecución de las actividades de planificación financiera, datos reales, cierre y generación de informes para las unidades asignadas, en estrecha cooperación con la Región de Control Financiero. Actuar como receptor de servicios para los datos financieros reales y los servicios de cierre proporcionados por la región a su cargo. Asegurar la entrega y ejecución de las operaciones y actividades de apoyo al control comercial de la organización regional de control financiero según lo acordado en los acuerdos de servicio. Apoyar a loslideres de procesos globales en términos de estandarización y aseguramiento de estandares globales.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Esta posición tiene a cargo la gestión de México, Guatemala y Costa Rica.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El reto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Realizar reportes de actividades mensuales (incluidos KPIs acordados) para ventas, margenes, variaciones de precios de compra, eficiencia, OPEX, capital de trabajo y CAPEX.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Apoyar la elaboración de presupuestos y pronósticos de ventas y operaciones, incluidos la fabricación y los costos.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Asegurar que los volumenes de inventario en SAP se reconcilien y verifiquen con los recuentos de inventario y que dichos valores en inventario esten actualizados<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Preparar informes consolidados de CAPEX y proyectos.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinar y controlar la puntualidad, la precisión y la integridad de las actividades de informes y cierre de fin de mes, realizadas por las diferentes regiones a su cargo.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Apoyar y coordinar el proceso de elaboración de presupuestos y pronósticos, que incluye la configuración de los ciclos de asignación y distribución y la entrada del presupuesto en SAP.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Dar orientación a los empleados de control financiero local.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Velar por el cumplimiento legal en materia de contratos con clientes y proveedores.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Asegurar un control interno adecuado en la función financiera de acuerdo con los requisitos y estándares establecidos..<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ser el responsable de los trámites de pago, actuando como primera firma.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ser socio comercial de todas las auditorías operativas internas en el país e impulsar la eficiencia de las auditorías.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinar la planificación anual y el proceso de presupuesto.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Preparar informes financieros y previsiones para todas las unidades de negocio de su región (presupuesto, informes trimestrales y mensuales).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Apoyar la gestión de efectivo, la planificación de efectivo, las actividades de financiación y garantizar la disponibilidad de fondos de acuerdo con dicha planificación.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Exigir el cumplimiento del trabajo financiero,, como resultado de las optimizaciones continuas de los procesos, además de velar la mejora continua.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Apoyar y facilitar la creación y el mantenimiento de relaciones con pares (como gerentes financieros regionales, controladores de operaciones, sitios, negocios y comerciales, control de operaciones de GPL, gerente de cuentas de BG, FSS y otros líderes de equipo en la región).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Asumir un papel de apoyo en el monitoreo y aplicación de la configuración adecuada de funciones y la gestión de cambios para el sistema de organización del país y apoyar a <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <b>QA TECHNICIAN 1-EVANSVILLE, IN<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Purpose of the job<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Safely performs all functions in support of DEPAM Operations responsibilities.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Performs Color, Mold and Quality testing for incoming materials, start-up, in-process and finished products under standard and specialized testing methods to ensure compliance with Color and Quality specifications. Enters and interacts with data from several software systems (SAP, Microsoft office) to reflect testing requirements, testing results and required corrective actions. Dispositions product and isolates defective products\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Performs functions to support Operations and R&amp;T related to fabrication of color mixes, molding of standard and specialized specimens.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Monitors equipment controls, troubleshoots quality equipment, leads troubleshooting efforts in resolving color and quality issues. Performs specialized quality equipment changeovers.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Provides shift guidance, personnel coordination in quality and color areas and ensures effective, in-depth turnover at shift changes. Liaison with Quality and Production Supervision.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Safely performs all functions in support of DEPAM Operations responsibilities.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Performs Color, Mold and Quality testing for incoming materials, start-up, in-process and finished products under standard and specialized testing methods to ensure compliance with Color and Quality specifications. Enters and interacts with data from several software systems (SAP, Microsoft office) to reflect testing requirements, testing results and required corrective actions. Dispositions product and isolates defective products\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Performs functions to support Operations and R&amp;T related to fabrication of color mixes, molding of standard and specialized specimens.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Monitors equipment controls, troubleshoots quality equipment, leads troubleshooting efforts in resolving color and quality issues. Performs specialized quality equipment changeovers.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Provides shift guidance, personnel coordination in quality and color areas and ensures effective, in-depth turnover at shift changes. Liaison with Quality and Production Supervision.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Job Context<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   DSM Engineering Plastics produces engineered thermoplastic compounds in close tolerance custom colors, black and natural that must meet multiple Customer specification requirements. These requirements may be national or international test standards, Customer specific test methods or DSM Global methods.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The equipment used is complex and requires computer literacy and multiple activity tasking. Priorities change frequently with communication between multiple groups necessary for effective control of processes and products.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The QA Technician 1 requires mechanical and logic skills to control, prevent and identify problems with required test and processing\u002Fmixing equipment. Additionally, Color acuity and understanding of color technology are important to success in this position.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Thorough working knowledge of SAP QM and related functions, knowledge of material transactions in related areas and an understanding of other software that may be used for testing in the Labs and in support of Operations and Supply Chain functions is key to success in this position.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The regular position will have hours that support a continuous (24\u002F7) operation.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key Areas of Accountability \u002F Responsibility<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li>Train other Lab Techs on the proper use and care of equipment to maximize accuracy and prevent damage.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Assists in the installation of new, revised, or upgraded equipment in the lab, verifying the safety aspects meet DSM’s demanding requirements as needed.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Disposition product based upon testing results and quality (SAP) requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Acquire samples based on Inspection Plan (SAP) requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Perform mechanical and chemical testing as required in the SAP Inspection Plan.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Performs color quality control checks on production orders through the evaluation of samples prepared by molding \u002F extrusion.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Performs visual color assessments, and takes color measurements with a spectrophotometer to determine the acceptability of samples includes R&amp;T projects.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Performs start up, in process and post process testing and evaluation of products and processes as specified.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Provide information and feedback to Production staff on quality of production.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Isolate defective product when encountered in Operations.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Monitors inventories of Laboratory supplies and equipment and proceeds with steps to replenish as needed.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Active participation and involvement in MOC process to maintain a safe, consistent workplace.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Provides support and data transfer as needed for databases.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Approves incoming raw materials following Incoming Material Verification processes as needed.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Performs outgoing sampling and quality evaluations as required<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Makes formulation adjustments to correct off-color compounds and maintains color quality records per ISO requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Weighs color and additive raw materials for extruder mixes. Formulates, mixes and tests off line color mixes in support of manufacturing. Maintains log of jobs completed, raw materials and weigh-ups used and labels raw materials as required.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Produces injection molded ASTM and ISO test specimens in support of Production and R&amp;D. Provides molding and problem solving services to meet or exceed customer expectations.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Maintains clean and orderly work areas, including storing materials\u002Ftools neatly, sweeping\u002Fmopping floors, dusting, cleaning \u002F wiping work surfaces, emptying drip pans &amp; removing trash and waste materials.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Performs special projects and related duties as assigned.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Complies with established safety and environmental policies and procedures and actively participates in safety improvement<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for the entry of data into all Quality databases.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for the review and authorization of results.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for the analysis of results, including statements of conformity or opinions and interpretations.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible to notify appropriate personnel of quality failures.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for isolating defective materials when encountered.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for performing testing to meet changing Customer requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible to communicate issues and requirements to other shifts.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for creating and maintaining equipment logs including required maintenance, calibration, verification, and other required care as needed.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Work Level Permit: 1A, 1B<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Complexity of the job<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Requirements of the job sometimes cause conflicts and multiple actions. Communication must occur on several levels to be effective (to Production Supervisor, QA Manager and Operator). These communications are made to union and non-union Employees.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Multiple test standards exist for similar tests. While these tests may be similar, the individual standards must be followed closely in order to attain accurate and correct data.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   This position requires mechanical aptitude and skill as well as good color acuity and perception. Due to the complexity of the equipment in the labs, the union of mechanical equipment with computer, good computer literacy and logical thought processes are required. Additionally, the required knowledge of color sciences and color judgment add another level of complexity to this position.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Knowledge and Education Level<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   High school diploma (or GED) is required for this position. College courses (most beneficial: math, chemistry, physics, color sciences, mechanics) will help provide knowledge of some of the testing theories. The position requires good computer literacy. Due to the mechanical\u002Flogical nature of the position, prior work history with highly specialized mechanical equipment preferred.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Experience in Engineering thermoplastics, Quality Assurance, destructive testing, Quality Systems, and mechanical equipment repair, control and calibration, experience in Color technology are beneficial to success in this <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM es una empresa global, “purpose-led”, con base científica y activa en los campos de la nutrición, la salud y la vida sostenible. El propósito de DSM es crear vidas más brillantes para todos. DSM afronta con sus productos y soluciones algunos de los retos mundiales actuales más importantes, a la vez que logra prosperidad económica y valor medioambiental y social para todas las partes interesadas (clientes, empleados, accionistas y la sociedad en general). DSM ofrece soluciones innovadoras para la nutrición humana y animal, higiene personal y fragancias, productos sanitarios, productos ecológicos y aplicaciones, y nueva movilidad y conectividad. DSM y sus empresas asociadas arrojan un volumen de ventas netas anual de aproximadamente 10 000 millones de euros y cuentan con unos 23.000 empleados. La empresa se fundó en 1902 y cotiza en Euronext Ámsterdam. Más información en www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <p><b>Operador de Producción<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El reto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Ejecutar todas aquellas actividades operativas que se realizar durante el proceso de fabricación de premezclas en la planta de ANH, operando adecuadamente los equipos y los materiales relacionados y correspondientes a su puesto, siguiendo los procedimientos, guías y políticas establecidos en los aspectos de procesos, calidad, seguridad e higiene lo cual nos permita cumplir con los productos en tiempo, calidad y cantidad y así satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes internos y externos, reportando oportunamente cualquier anomalía detectada.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La posición:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Operar los equipos que correspondan y el manejo adecuado de los materiales, de acuerdo al nivel de certificación que mantenga, siguiendo los procedimientos y guías de calidad establecidos para cada puesto de Producción ANH; para con esto dar cumplimiento al Sistema de Calidad y el uso eficiente de los recursos que se tienen asignados.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Cumplir con los procesos de capacitación y certificación como operador multifunción de producción ANH, siguiendo los pasos en el procedimiento para tal fin para de esta forma ir certificando cada uno de los puestos y niveles definidos y finalmente certificarse como operador multifunción.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Desempeñar las actividades operativas de producción de manera segura e higiénica y siguiendo medida que promuevan la protección del ambiente cumpliendo las políticas y medidas establecidas y otras medidas y acciones que promuevan el Departamento de Seguridad e Higiene, Protección Ambiental y Recursos Humanos, para así reducir riesgos que afecten a las personas, a la compañía y al medio habiente.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Trabajar siguiendo lo establecido en nuestro Sistema de Calidad, dando cumplimiento a los requisitos de Calidad establecidos en cada uno de los puestos, para de esta forma asegurar la calidad de los productos que se fabriquen.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Cuidar y mantener en óptimas condiciones de trabajo los equipos asignados para su operación, siguiendo los procedimientos de operación y de limpieza de las áreas, apoyados por el personal de mantenimiento y la supervisión, para así evitar paros de la operación y prolongar la vida útil de los equipos asignados.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Solicitar al supervisor de producción la creación de una Notificación de Trabajo cuando se detecte un problema de mantenimiento.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conducirse en todo momento con respeto y disciplina, hacia sus compañeros y superiores; dando cumplimiento al Reglamento Interior de Trabajo de la empresa.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El ideal:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Secundaria terminada<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experiencia previa en el área de producción de empresas de manufactura del giro de alimentos o farmaceuticos<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Disponibilidad para rolar turnos<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conocimientos de Buenas practicas de manufactura, reglamentos de seguridad y normas de calidad en la proucción.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La Compensación:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Trabajar para DSM significa una oportunidad de contribuir realmente a mejorar la vida de las personas resolviendo los retos presentes en el mundo de hoy. Trabajos desafiantes, oportunidades de crecimiento y un ambiente inspirador permiten que puedas alcanzar tu desarrollo personal. DSM reconoce que el éxito continuo de una compañía depende del desarrollo frecuente y compromiso de nuestros colaboradores buscando una política de remuneración justa y competitiva, reconociendo las competencias y desempeño individual y del equipo.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>Procedimiento y Contacto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   ¿Estas interesado en esta posición por favor aplica en linea a través del portal de carreras (www.dsm.com\u002Fcareers).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM es un empleador que promueve la igualdad de oportunidades y la discriminación positiva, y todos los solicitantes cualificados serán considerados para el puesto sin distinción de raza, color, religión, sexo, nación de origen, edad, estado de veterano protegido, estado de persona cualificada con una discapacidad o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM Biomedical is the world’s unrivaled biomaterials expert and committed partner in driving sustainable innovation in healthcare. For more than 30 years, the company has been at the forefront of biomaterial science and process innovation, and the leading resource for global medical device and pharmaceutical companies. As a strategic partner with an approach driven not only by market dynamics but by the unique needs of every customer, DSM Biomedical brings an unparalleled breadth of product portfolios, proprietary manufacturing and processing capabilities, world-class IP, and extensive regulatory experience and expertise. We are looking for candidates who are bright and communicative with an eye for detail, who enjoy team-work and problem-solving to join us as our Senior Process Engineer. At our core, our business starts with our people and we’re eager to include you! Our ideal candidates are collaborative individuals who are caring and courageous. These candidates are committed to continued growth and bringing new ideas forward to propel our thinking and drive to set our pace.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   If you’re operating procedures are in place and PSM-compliant.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Reviewing contractor safety programs and safety performance.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordinating activities for all Management of Change (MOC) reviews involving process safety.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participating in all Process Safety Incident Investigations (RCA) and track recommendations emerging from the investigation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Scheduling compliance audits, selects team members, and identify audit team leader.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Updating and reports out monthly HAZOP and Safety MDFs (Management Decision Forms).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Leading Explosion Risk Assessments (ERA) when needed.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participating in Site Audits and PSM reviews.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Providing direct technical support to assigned processing areas<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Leading, analyzing, and reporting on process related investigations of deviations, customer complaints and\u002For other areas of concern to provide effective corrective solutions<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Managing implementation of change control in a highly regulated environment to ensure any changes to the process are reviewed and approved to meet safety, quality, and process integrity requirements<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supporting the successful integration and scale-up of new or revised processes into the production environment<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Collaborating with project engineering on expansion, capital, and improvement projects as needed<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensuring processes and employees are compliant with DSM safety, environmental, Our materials enable lighter, stronger and more durable products – which in turn makes people’s lives safer, more convenient and healthier – and all while helping to tackle carbon emissions.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Perhaps the greatest trend driving our markets is the move towards mobility and connectivity – on the road, in the home and office, and on the street. We’re seeing new standards in design and usability coupled with our planet’s pressing need to cut energy use and avoid waste through circular design thinking.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Take ‘thinovation’ – the trend for creating smaller, lighter, greener and safer working parts in electronic devices. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Manufacturing Engineering Manager – Exton, PA (on-site)<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Will:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   The Manufacturing Engineering Manager will provide purpose, direction, and motivation while operating to accomplish the goals and improving the Manufacturing Engineering Group. They will provide guidance and expertise towards the final stage development, scale up, and commercialization of new and existing product lines and tooling for Polymer, Device and Natural Material COE’s. They will be managing a team of Engineers and Technicians tasked with developing and\u002For improving current and future DSM Biomedical materials-based machinery\u002Ftooling and products\u002F processes. They will direct or participate on project teams within the PMP\u002Fproject management process. This position manages product lifecycle support for running business. This position evaluates and investigates new technologies and potential relationships with outside companies’ products in support of the Strategic Business Initiatives.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Responsibilities:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Manage evaluation of scale up options, selection, &amp; implementation by leading projects, providing project updates, and offering input for the next phases.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manage evaluation of potential new product\u002F process proposals and provide recommendations as to the scope and necessary timing required for specific production targets.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develop and review project plans, cost estimates, schedules, and resource requirements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Lead Manufacturing Reviews of new products and process improvements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Cultivate a team with the expertise to provide in-house development and\u002For technical leadership to Research &amp; Development, Commercialization, and Operations Groups.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manage continuous improvement of products\u002F processes to achieve improvements in productivity, yield and\u002For operating costs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manage annual goals\u002Fobjectives.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Perform Personal Development Reviews (PDR) on direct reports, fostering individual growth and development.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manage the preparation of applicable technical sections of regulatory documents (FDA 510k, IDE, PMA, CE), grants, &amp; patent filings.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Execute the job within the applicable DSM, OSHA, EPA, ISO, FDA, CE, &amp; other requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A competitive compensation package, with comprehensive health and welfare benefits.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A place to grow and develop.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A company that is purpose-led and performance-driven in a corporate culture that values people and planet.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The opportunity to work on growing brands and build on a strong foundation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The chance to make improvements and make an impact on the business.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Bachelors or Master’s degree in Engineering — Biomedical, Mechanical, Electrical, Chemical, Materials or related field. Master’s degree in Business is beneficial.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A minimum of 7 years of experience in Medical Device or related industry.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Lean Six Sigma Green Belt certification required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrated project management experience. Ability to apply Project Management techniques according to PMP. DSM PMP Silver training required. External PMP certifications preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Extensive knowledge and experience working with products\u002Fprocesses used in medical device environment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent interpersonal skills to interact and communicate effectively with all levels of personnel.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to lead &amp; manage and\u002F or function as part of a multifunctional and multi- departmental team.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proficient in the use of MSOffice, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Project, IYlinitab, and SharePoint.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Extensive knowledge and experience working with manufacturing machinery and tooling in a medical device environment or related industry.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Extensive knowledge and experience working with Engineering &amp; Quality tools (Statistics, Lean Six Sigma, DFM, DOE).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge and experience working with the Regulatory pathways associated with IDE, 510k, PMA, &amp; CE including the associated ISO &amp; ASTM standards.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Broad and comprehensive knowledge of engineering theories, concepts and practices with the ability to use these in complex, difficult and\u002For unprecedented situations.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills to choose the best solution and solve problems as decisions may have major implications.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Accuracy, a detail orientation, initiative to multi-task with deadlines, flexible can-do attitude, and ability to adjust workload to meet varying schedules.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Industrial scale hands-on experience with process optimization focus.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Understanding of financial and accounting requirements in projects<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About Biomedical:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   DSM Biomedical is the world’s unrivaled biomaterials expert and committed partner in driving sustainable innovation in healthcare. For more than 30 years, the company has been at the forefront of biomaterial science and process innovation, and the leading resource for global medical device and pharmaceutical companies. As a strategic partner with an approach driven not only by market dynamics but by the unique needs of every customer, DSM Biomedical brings an unparalleled breadth of product portfolios, proprietary manufacturing and processing capabilities, world-class IP, and extensive regulatory experience and expertise. Furthermore, DSM Biomedical’s products and services are recognized for their unmatched quality, consistency, and performance in multiple markets across the globe, supporting their company-wide vision of solving the world’s healthcare needs through sustainable science. To learn more, visit DSMBiomedical.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified Monitoring equipment reliability, facilitating root cause analysis and failure mode and effects analysis, and coordinating with parties involved in finding solutions to improve reliability. Address notifications of failures and inspections, and provide production and maintenance support for normal operation, project work, and startup\u002Fshutdown for equipment.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A competitive compensation package, with comprehensive health benefits<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A place to grow and <li>Develop and maintain key performance indicators to monitor equipment reliability<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Facilitate root cause analysis and failure mode and effects analysis, and coordinate parties involved in finding solutions to improve reliability<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Develop and implement the preventive and predictive maintenance program<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Establish and communicate the equipment<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manage local capital projects to improve reliability, including project budgets and schedules, consult on mechanical aspects of projects, support the process safety and loss control role as assigned, and assist in project start-up with respect to mechanical aspects<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> implementation for Corrective and Preventive actions.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Support the customer complaints process, including entering complaint information into the related system and completing Level 1 investigations (DHR reviews) on complaints. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Respond to customer requests by completing surveys, collecting and providing data, records, documents, and other requested external standards, monitor changes to these documents and issue and track the gap analysis tasks of related Subject Matter Experts.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Analyze data and generate findings suitable for <li>Adhere to Quality System procedures, ISO 13485, 21 CFR part 820 and current applicable regulatory requirements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Complete other tasks as assigned by the Quality Systems Manager.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A competitive compensation package, with comprehensive health and develops novel materials-based solutions to meet the present and future needs of the medical device industry. The company’s product portfolio includes coatings, drug delivery platforms, mechanical devices, and a wide range of biomedical materials that enable the replacement, repair, enhancement and the regeneration of tissue and organ functions in the body. Its novel materials-based solutions are designed to meet the needs of the medical device industry. The biomedical market is highly innovative and dynamic.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       Hybrid Position: Work both from Home Office and Troy Michigan facilites Office\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b>APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER, AUTOMOTIVE<\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <div>\n       The position of Application Development Engineer, Automotive for this account team is one of two primary technical interfaces to our customers. The purpose of the position is to ensure that the full range of DSM Engineering Materials’ (DEM’s) expertise in applications, materials, and testing is available to OEM and Tier customers. In addition, the Application Development Engineer serves to maintain and grow profitable business for DEM.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       DSM Engineering Materials is a Business Group in the Performance Materials cluster of DSM. DEM is one of the world’s leading suppliers of engineering thermoplastics, offering a broad portfolio of high performance products. DEM owns manufacturing facilities around the world to supply consistent, high-quality products wherever needed.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       DEM is developing product lines on a global and a regional perspective. The product lines are generating existing and new business via 3 regions: Europe, Asia Pacific and the Americas.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       The products are very technical, with a broad range of specifications and potential application areas. In most cases, the products are replacing competitive products in existing applications and \u002F or penetrating new applications. Both innovation of products and applications is crucial to becoming and remaining a key supplier to the customer. Development cycles for products &amp; applications vary from months to 3 years.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       The markets in which DEM operates are very dynamic, with customers who regularly use complex value chains and often focus more on a global vehicle and component development. Customers of DEM value technology, application knowledge, and total costs of their products, among other drivers. To operate in this field, colleagues at DEM manage many relationships in order to achieve new &amp; lasting customer satisfaction and sustained business growth. Business intelligence &amp; innovation are crucial to be ahead of competitors &amp; to keep the development funnel loaded.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       DEM is working according to defined processes for both PTO and OTC\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b>General Position Accountabilities &amp; Responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <div>\n       This position is based on years of experience, demonstrated leadership and execution of customer and business objectives, internal and external.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       The general responsibilities of the Application Development Engineer include:\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support development of new business through the generation of technical value proposals and multiplication tools, application and design knowledge. (market\u002Fapplication, product, processing)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Lead and direct Research &amp; Technology product development projects on assigned applications via communication with global team and project management processes.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Translate customer &amp; application requirements into product specifications to recommend existing products or, if necessary, to draw up product development specifications in consultation with relevant DSM functions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Predict critical failure modes in our customer's applications and relate them to marketable material &amp; design solutions; understand the value-added solutions and use them to differentiate DSM service; support AM to capture that value at the customer.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>As the leading technical interface at customers, incorporate specialists (Tech Service, (G)TPM, PD’s, CAE, Research &amp; Technology \u002F DSM Ahead, or other local labs) when required to increase opportunities for profit and growth.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Make proposals regarding optimum grades, processing, and design.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Follow the strict NDA and contract requirements of the customer in internal communications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Develop segment-driven, multi-product technical know-how for given application spaces.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Manage both internal and external contacts\u002Fnetworks related to existing technologies and applications, such that proper focus can be concentrated on application technology development.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Manage the development process in a value chain with multiple OEM and tiers.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Insure that technical development goals are part of the Strategic Account Plan (owners – AM’s)<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <ul>\n       <li>This position is embedded in a matrix organization with various dimensions: \n        <ul>\n         <li>Regions: While deliverables and the reporting line are in the Americas, work with other regions (Europe\u002FAsia) is required from time to time; this means significant work time and cultural differences are a job requirement<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Materials: Since deliverables are often by market segment, work in multiple products will be required, and adherence to segment and regional strategies for product lines must additionally be consistent<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Segments: Deliverables may be for multiple segments, and adherence to allocations of time should be consistent with target allocations<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Roles: As many targets are team oriented with cross-functional teams including Account Managers, Segment Team Leaders, clear understanding of the role in a team should be communicated and practiced.<\u002Fli> \n        <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n       <li>The proper balance must be struck between short term targets (acquisition and commercialization of project opportunities) and longer term Key Customer Account Plan objectives (developing value propositions for future growth, innovating in materials &amp; applications)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>The proper link must be made between market needs and company goals.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>The position requires the ability to work well as a team member across regional and cultural lines.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>The position requires the ability to harvest technical information and data from within the DEP scientific and R&amp;T community, and skillfully interpret and present the information to the Key Customer engineering community at a rapid pace.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Our customer markets are extremely fast moving and dynamic requiring flexibility in work style, schedule, and focus.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Daily contact with customers can be required to support current and future business objectives.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Changing technical demands from DSM, the industry and the customers will need to be managed and addressed.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b>Educational level:<\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Bachelor of Science in Mechanical, Chemical, or Electrical Engineering or related field REQUIRED<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Masters Preferred<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b>Knowledge and required skills:<\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Technical<\u002Fb> \n        <ul>\n         <li>In-depth knowledge of the automotive landscape in engineering thermoplastics<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Plastic part design knowledge (especially for manufacturability)<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Plastic processing and tooling knowledge is a plus<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Six Sigma methodology is a plus<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Interpretation of various CAE packages (Moldflow, FEA, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n        <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n       <li><b>Computer<\u002Fb> \n        <ul>\n         <li>Expert skills in internet technical searches<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Proficiency in Word Processing (i.e. Microsoft Word), Spreadsheets (i.e. Microsoft Excel), and Presentation (i.e. Microsoft PowerPoint) packages<\u002Fli> \n        <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n       <li><b>Professional<\u002Fb> \n        <ul>\n         <li>Customer relationship management<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Organizational skills<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Team orientation<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Speed in responsiveness<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Polished written and verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Comfortable in self-starting or taking direction<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Project leadership skills<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful><br> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b>Required level of experiences<\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Minimum of 7 years of Application experience in a plastics and\u002For customer application-related discipline<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated accomplishment in leading large development or operational projects<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven success in large and small cross-function team environment<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <div><\u002Fdiv> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>QA TECHNICIAN 1-EVANSVILLE, IN<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Purpose of the job<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Safely performs all functions in support of DEPAM Operations responsibilities.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Performs Color, Mold and Quality testing for incoming materials, start-up, in-process and finished products under standard and specialized testing methods to ensure compliance with Color and Quality specifications. Enters and interacts with data from several software systems (SAP, Microsoft office) to reflect testing requirements, testing results and required corrective actions. Dispositions product and isolates defective products\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Performs functions to support Operations and R&amp;T related to fabrication of color mixes, molding of standard and specialized specimens.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Monitors equipment controls, troubleshoots quality equipment, leads troubleshooting efforts in resolving color and quality issues. Performs specialized quality equipment changeovers.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Provides shift guidance, personnel coordination in quality and color areas and ensures effective, in-depth turnover at shift changes. Liaison with Quality and Production Supervision.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Safely performs all functions in support of DEPAM Operations responsibilities.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Performs Color, Mold and Quality testing for incoming materials, start-up, in-process and finished products under standard and specialized testing methods to ensure compliance with Color and Quality specifications. Enters and interacts with data from several software systems (SAP, Microsoft office) to reflect testing requirements, testing results and required corrective actions. Dispositions product and isolates defective products\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Performs functions to support Operations and R&amp;T related to fabrication of color mixes, molding of standard and specialized specimens.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Monitors equipment controls, troubleshoots quality equipment, leads troubleshooting efforts in resolving color and quality issues. Performs specialized quality equipment changeovers.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Provides shift guidance, personnel coordination in quality and color areas and ensures effective, in-depth turnover at shift changes. Liaison with Quality and Production Supervision.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Job Context<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   DSM Engineering Plastics produces engineered thermoplastic compounds in close tolerance custom colors, black and natural that must meet multiple Customer specification requirements. These requirements may be national or international test standards, Customer specific test methods or DSM Global methods.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The equipment used is complex and requires computer literacy and multiple activity tasking. Priorities change frequently with communication between multiple groups necessary for effective control of processes and products.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The QA Technician 1 requires mechanical and logic skills to control, prevent and identify problems with required test and processing\u002Fmixing equipment. Additionally, Color acuity and understanding of color technology are important to success in this position.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Thorough working knowledge of SAP QM and related functions, knowledge of material transactions in related areas and an understanding of other software that may be used for testing in the Labs and in support of Operations and Supply Chain functions is key to success in this position.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   The regular position will have hours that support a continuous (24\u002F7) operation.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key Areas of Accountability \u002F Responsibility<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <ul>\n    <li>Train other Lab Techs on the proper use and care of equipment to maximize accuracy and prevent damage.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Assists in the installation of new, revised, or upgraded equipment in the lab, verifying the safety aspects meet DSM’s demanding requirements as needed.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Disposition product based upon testing results and quality (SAP) requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Acquire samples based on Inspection Plan (SAP) requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Perform mechanical and chemical testing as required in the SAP Inspection Plan.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Performs color quality control checks on production orders through the evaluation of samples prepared by molding \u002F extrusion.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Performs visual color assessments, and takes color measurements with a spectrophotometer to determine the acceptability of samples includes R&amp;T projects.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Performs start up, in process and post process testing and evaluation of products and processes as specified.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Provide information and feedback to Production staff on quality of production.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Isolate defective product when encountered in Operations.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Monitors inventories of Laboratory supplies and equipment and proceeds with steps to replenish as needed.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Active participation and involvement in MOC process to maintain a safe, consistent workplace.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Provides support and data transfer as needed for databases.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Approves incoming raw materials following Incoming Material Verification processes as needed.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Performs outgoing sampling and quality evaluations as required<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Makes formulation adjustments to correct off-color compounds and maintains color quality records per ISO requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Weighs color and additive raw materials for extruder mixes. Formulates, mixes and tests off line color mixes in support of manufacturing. Maintains log of jobs completed, raw materials and weigh-ups used and labels raw materials as required.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Produces injection molded ASTM and ISO test specimens in support of Production and R&amp;D. Provides molding and problem solving services to meet or exceed customer expectations.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Maintains clean and orderly work areas, including storing materials\u002Ftools neatly, sweeping\u002Fmopping floors, dusting, cleaning \u002F wiping work surfaces, emptying drip pans &amp; removing trash and waste materials.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Performs special projects and related duties as assigned.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Complies with established safety and environmental policies and procedures and actively participates in safety improvement<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for the entry of data into all Quality databases.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for the review and authorization of results.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for the analysis of results, including statements of conformity or opinions and interpretations.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible to notify appropriate personnel of quality failures.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for isolating defective materials when encountered.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for performing testing to meet changing Customer requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible to communicate issues and requirements to other shifts.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Responsible for creating and maintaining equipment logs including required maintenance, calibration, verification, and other required care as needed.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Work Level Permit: 1A, 1B<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Complexity of the job<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Requirements of the job sometimes cause conflicts and multiple actions. Communication must occur on several levels to be effective (to Production Supervisor, QA Manager and Operator). These communications are made to union and non-union Employees.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Multiple test standards exist for similar tests. While these tests may be similar, the individual standards must be followed closely in order to attain accurate and correct data.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   This position requires mechanical aptitude and skill as well as good color acuity and perception. Due to the complexity of the equipment in the labs, the union of mechanical equipment with computer, good computer literacy and logical thought processes are required. Additionally, the required knowledge of color sciences and color judgment add another level of complexity to this position.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Knowledge and Education Level<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   High school diploma (or GED) is required for this position. College courses (most beneficial: math, chemistry, physics, color sciences, mechanics) will help provide knowledge of some of the testing theories. The position requires good computer literacy. Due to the mechanical\u002Flogical nature of the position, prior work history with highly specialized mechanical equipment preferred.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Experience in Engineering thermoplastics, Quality Assurance, destructive testing, Quality Systems, and mechanical equipment repair, control and calibration, experience in Color technology are beneficial to success in this position.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Required level of experiences<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Experience in Engineering thermoplastics, Quality Assurance, destructive testing, Quality Systems, and mechanical equipment repair, control and calibration, experience in Color technology are beneficial to success in this position.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
