Continuous improvement. Trouble-shooting. \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   2) Process and Product Development, including, but not limited to: Design and scale-up of new processes Testing of new equipment and new technologies Technology transfer to Manufacturing \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   3) Project Management: Manage all stages of a project from idea phase to implementation.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n and\u002For perform process development work for new products.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Collect, analyze, interpret and effectively communicate data from lab and pilot-scale experiments. <\u002Fli>\n patent filings.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Execute the job within the applicable DSM, GMP, OSHA, EPA, ISO, FDA, CE, &amp; other requirements\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A competitive compensation package, with comprehensive health and welfare benefits.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A place to grow and develop.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A company that is purpose-led and performance-driven in a corporate culture that values people and planet.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The opportunity to work on growing brands and build on a strong foundation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The chance to make improvements and make an impact on the business.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Bachelors or Master’s degree in Engineering – Biomedical, Mechanical, Electrical, Chemical, Materials, or related field<\u002Fli> \n   <li>5-8 years of experience in Medical Device or related industry<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proficient in the use of MSOffice, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Project, Minitab, CAD Software, and SharePoint<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Demonstrated project management experience. Ability to apply Project Management techniques according to PMP. DSM PMP Silver training preferred<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Extensive experience of chemical and melt processing techniques (i.e. machining, injection molding, extrusion, sterilization), manufacturing machinery and tooling<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Extensive knowledge of medically useful biomaterials (bio-resorbable and non-degradable)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Extensive knowledge and expertise working with Engineering &amp; Quality tools (Statistics, Lean Six Sigma, DFM, DOE)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Working knowledge and experience working with the Regulatory pathways associated with IDE, 510k, PMA, &amp; CE including the associated ISO &amp; ASTM standards<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Extensive knowledge of electrical wiring schematics, electrical diagrams as well as PLC &amp; PC programming<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Lean Six Sigma Green Belt certification preferred<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge and experience with leading technology, application and implementation of manufacturing automation, robotics and data<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge and expertise of products\u002Fprocesses used in medical device environment<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge and experience working with manufacturing machinery and tooling in a medical device environment or related industry<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Knowledge and experience with leading technology, application and implementation of manufacturing automation, robotics and data exchange in manufacturing technologies (Industry 4.0)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About Biomedical:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   DSM Biomedical is a market leader in regenerative medicine and in the supply of biomaterials for medical devices. We have established a team of exceptionally talented and experienced individuals who are committed to innovation, collaboration and improving the medical professional and patient experiences. Our company possesses expertise in the research, development, scale-up, and supply of novel materials and medical devices. This market is growing at a double digit rate and is characterized by long term commitment. Intellectual property is of paramount importance in this high value added market arena. DSM Biomedical is part of the DSM Innovation Center and provides a proprietary product portfolio with coatings, drug delivery platforms and a wide range of biomedical materials that enable the replacement, repair, enhancement, and regeneration of tissue and organ functions in the body. Its novel, materials-based solutions are designed to meet the needs of the medical device and pharmaceutical industries. The ultimate objective is to improve the outcome for patients. DSM’s medical device expertise spans one of the broadest portfolios of medical materials, including biostable polyurethanes, ultra high molecular weight polyethylene’s, resorbable polymers, ceramics, collagens, extracellular matrices, silicone hydrogels, device coatings, and drug delivery platforms. Millions of products are produced each year for applications in orthopedics, sports medicine, ophthalmology, general surgery, and cardiology.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM es una empresa global, “purpose-led”, con base científica y activa en los campos de la nutrición, la salud y la vida sostenible. El propósito de DSM es crear vidas más brillantes para todos. DSM afronta con sus productos y soluciones algunos de los retos mundiales actuales más importantes, a la vez que logra prosperidad económica y valor medioambiental y social para todas las partes interesadas (clientes, empleados, accionistas y la sociedad en general). DSM ofrece soluciones innovadoras para la nutrición humana y animal, higiene personal y fragancias, productos sanitarios, productos ecológicos y aplicaciones, y nueva movilidad y conectividad. DSM y sus empresas asociadas arrojan un volumen de ventas netas anual de aproximadamente 10 000 millones de euros y cuentan con unos 23.000 empleados. La empresa se fundó en 1902 y cotiza en Euronext Ámsterdam. Más información en www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <p><b>Almacenista<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El reto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Realizar actividades de recepción, almacenaje, surtido, embarque y control de inventario de materias primas en el almacén, a través de las buenas prácticas de manufactura y buenas prácticas almacenamiento y distribución mediante el seguimiento de los procedimientos de operación cumpliendo con las normas de seguridad e higiene, con el uso de sistemas computarizados.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La posición:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Recibir, almacenar, embarcar, manejar e identificar debidamente los materiales.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proveer los materiales requeridos a producción.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Embarcar los materiales requeridos por los clientes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Llevar a cabo los conteos cíclicos.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manejo y control de materiales No Conforme, destrucción y seguimiento a materiales con posibilidad de recuperación.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Actualizar, Identificar y segregar en sistema las mermas generadas en los procesos. Así como informar cualquier diferencia de inventario a su reporte directo.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Cuidar y dar buen uso a los equipos de trabajo.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Detectar y notificar al responsable de almacén de cualquier problema que pueda afectar el estado de las instalaciones, equipo, afectar la veracidad de los inventarios, la integridad de los materiales y la seguridad personal dentro del almacén.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Mantener los almacenes cerrados, restringir el acceso.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participar activamente con los programas de desarrollo y mejora continua.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Participar en los análisis de Quejas de Cliente, así como en el análisis de desviaciones.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El ideal:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Preparatoria o carrera técnica conlcuida<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conocimiento en manejo de montacargas, licencia deseable<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Al menos dos años de experiencia de trabajo en almacén o cadena de suministro<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Disponibilidad para rolar turnos semanalmente (mañana, tarde y noche)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La Compensación:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Trabajar para DSM significa una oportunidad de contribuir realmente a mejorar la vida de las personas resolviendo los retos presentes en el mundo de hoy. Trabajos desafiantes, oportunidades de crecimiento y un ambiente inspirador permiten que puedas alcanzar tu desarrollo personal. DSM reconoce que el éxito continuo de una compañía depende del desarrollo frecuente y compromiso de nuestros colaboradores buscando una política de remuneración justa y competitiva, reconociendo las competencias y desempeño individual y del equipo.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>Procedimiento y Contacto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   ¿Estas interesado en esta posición por favor aplica en linea a través del portal de carreras (www.dsm.com\u002Fcareers).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM es un empleador que promueve la igualdad veterano protegido, estado de persona cualificada con una discapacidad o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n Exton, PA; or Cromwell, CT) and flexible work arrangements<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A dynamic work environment that gives you the ability to work autonomously as part of a diverse and inclusive team to find the right solutions<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your key responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Ensure that agreed services as agreed with FSS (Financial Shared Services) are delivered up to standard<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Provide all (accruals, provisions, corrections, etc.) content for Journal Entries (recurring and incidental) to the shared service center<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Responsible for (and analyses on) product costing, variance analyses manufacturing performance, Inventories, CAPEX and first line analyses and insights for actuals, forecast and budget and for setting up relevant allocation cycles in SAP<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provide evidence for the Internal Control Framework and follows up on remediation plans.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Point of contact for the Finance Business Partner &amp; <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Data Engineer, Bioprocessing – Columbia, MD (Hybrid)<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>What You’ll Do:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Create databases and use ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tools to collect, clean, store, and mine bioscience and process data. The successful candidate would join the Biotechnology &amp; Analysis Team in Columbia, MD, where they will be responsible for creating and implementing best practices for data capture, storage, and retrieval to enable the use of quantitative and data analytics\u002Fstatistical tools to assist with the development, operations and improvement of innovative Bioscience products and processes for the Health and Nutrition sector. This person will be directly involved in linking Information Technology to R&amp;D and to deliver insights to teams within the Biotechnology group.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Key Responsibilities:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Use advanced data mining and monitoring tools to collect, pre-process, clean and curate large data sets. Help to establish a future proof data management infrastructure and work closely with subject matter experts (SMEs) on data integrity and preparation in their areas of expertise. Through the creation and maintenance of data sets and visualization tools, insights into methods for maximizing performance, quality and consistency will be determined and fed back to teams at our R&amp;D and Operations\u002FManufacturing facilities in the Americas. The ideal candidate will partner with biotech and analysis scientists to organize and mine data to enable rapid product development and process optimization.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A competitive compensation package, with comprehensive health and welfare benefits<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A place to grow and develop<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A company that is purpose-led and performance-driven in a corporate culture that values people and planet<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The opportunity to work on growing brands and build on a strong foundation<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The chance to make improvements and make an impact on the business<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Mininum Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Biology, (Bio)Chemical Engineering or Biostatistics, or related field<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proficiency with scripting and workflow languages (e.g. Python or R) to manipulate datasets; additional experience with any ETL tool a plus.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Several years experience in data extraction, engineering, and management<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with cloud-based data storage and retrieval (AWS, Azure)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with (relational) databases and SQL<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience linking R&amp;D with digitalization efforts to deliver insightful observations which result in improvements within a Biotechnology, Fermentation or Bioprocess context<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Strong data analysis skills, including the use of statistics for the analysis of large data sets, necessary to develop R&amp;D hypotheses<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Familiarity with PowerShell scripting or basic understanding of bioprocess engineering in relation to control programming a plus<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in FAIR Data Management and Knowledge Management is considered a plus<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in working with multi-disciplinary teams across sites to design and execute fermentation optimization and\u002For strain characterization experiments<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Motivated self-starter with good organizational skills and the ability to multitask<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with ‘omics data is considered a plus<\u002Fli> \n   <li>An excellent oral and written communicator<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About R&amp;D:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Our Innovation, Research &amp; Development team propels our business into the future, with new discoveries at every corner. They work collaboratively with different departments and industry experts to make a positive difference to the future of millions of people and the planet we all share. Our Innovation, Research &amp; Development team is committed to seeing opportunities where others can’t, and boldly create innovative solutions that are safe, sustainable and life-changing.\n This role will be responsible for the analysis of raw materials, intermediates, and finished products manufactured or received in Germantown and Waukesha with an emphasis on standard operating procedures and good laboratory practices. The position must efficiently perform testing as well as data entry.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>What we bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Working for DSM means the opportunity to really contribute to improve people’s lives and solving the challenges of today’s world. Challenging jobs, career opportunities and an inspiring environment allow you to enhance your personal development. DSM recognizes that the on-going success of the company depends on the continued development and engagement of our employees and pursues a fair and competitive remuneration policy, recognizing individual and team competencies and performance.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>Your key responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Analysis of raw materials, intermediates, and finished products according to determined methods to ensure they meet or exceed customer specifications for food safety and quality requirements.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Autonomous analysis required<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Accurate and timely data entry of test results<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Interpretation of raw data<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to utilize aseptic technique and other essential lab skills<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ability to troubleshoot testing issues<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Bachelor’s degree (Microbiology, Biology, Chemistry, or related science)<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Minimum 3+ years of QC lab experience, preferably n the food industry.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Proficiency in SAP, SF360, and\u002For Sample Manager desired.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Lean Six Sigma certification is a plus.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Inspection &amp; testing experience within a GMP environment is adequate.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience with HACCP.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About Quality<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   No matter which team you are on, at DSM you’ll be part of a powerful shared purpose – to create brighter lives for all. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <div><\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       Hybrid Position: Work both from Home Office and Troy Michigan facilites Office\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b>APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER, AUTOMOTIVE<\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <div>\n       The position of Application Development Engineer, Automotive for this account team is one of two primary technical interfaces to our customers. The purpose of the position is to ensure that the full range of DSM Engineering Materials’ (DEM’s) expertise in applications, materials, and testing is available to OEM and Tier customers. In addition, the Application Development Engineer serves to maintain and grow profitable business for DEM.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       DSM Engineering Materials is a Business Group in the Performance Materials cluster of DSM. DEM is one of the world’s leading suppliers of engineering thermoplastics, offering a broad portfolio of high performance products. DEM owns manufacturing facilities around the world to supply consistent, high-quality products wherever needed.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       DEM is developing product lines on a global and a regional perspective. The product lines are generating existing and new business via 3 regions: Europe, Asia Pacific and the Americas.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       The products are very technical, with a broad range of specifications and potential application areas. In most cases, the products are replacing competitive products in existing applications and \u002F or penetrating new applications. Both innovation of products and applications is crucial to becoming and remaining a key supplier to the customer. Development cycles for products &amp; applications vary from months to 3 years.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       The markets in which DEM operates are very dynamic, with customers who regularly use complex value chains and often focus more on a global vehicle and component development. Customers of DEM value technology, application knowledge, and total costs of their products, among other drivers. To operate in this field, colleagues at DEM manage many relationships in order to achieve new &amp; lasting customer satisfaction and sustained business growth. Business intelligence &amp; innovation are crucial to be ahead of competitors &amp; to keep the development funnel loaded.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       DEM is working according to defined processes for both PTO and OTC\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b>General Position Accountabilities &amp; Responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <div>\n       This position is based on years of experience, demonstrated leadership and execution of customer and business objectives, internal and external.\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       The general responsibilities of the Application Development Engineer include:\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Support development of new business through the generation of technical value proposals and multiplication tools, application and design knowledge. (market\u002Fapplication, product, processing)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Lead and direct Research &amp; Technology product development projects on assigned applications via communication with global team and project management processes.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Translate customer &amp; application requirements into product specifications to recommend existing products or, if necessary, to draw up product development specifications in consultation with relevant DSM functions.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Predict critical failure modes in our customer’s applications and relate them to marketable material &amp; design solutions; understand the value-added solutions and use them to differentiate DSM service; support AM to capture that value at the customer.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>As the leading technical interface at customers, incorporate specialists (Tech Service, (G)TPM, PD’s, CAE, Research &amp; Technology \u002F DSM Ahead, or other local labs) when required to increase opportunities for profit and growth.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Make proposals regarding optimum grades, processing, and design.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Follow the strict NDA and contract requirements of the customer in internal communications.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Develop segment-driven, multi-product technical know-how for given application spaces.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Manage both internal and external contacts\u002Fnetworks related to existing technologies and applications, such that proper focus can be concentrated on application technology development.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Manage the development process in a value chain with multiple OEM and tiers.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Insure that technical development goals are part of the Strategic Account Plan (owners – AM’s)<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <ul>\n       <li>This position is embedded in a matrix organization with various dimensions: \n        <ul>\n         <li>Regions: While deliverables and the reporting line are in the Americas, work with other regions (Europe\u002FAsia) is required from time to time; this means significant work time and cultural differences are a job requirement<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Materials: Since deliverables are often by market segment, work in multiple products will be required, and adherence to segment and regional strategies for product lines must additionally be consistent<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Segments: Deliverables may be for multiple segments, and adherence to allocations of time should be consistent with target allocations<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Roles: As many targets are team oriented with cross-functional teams including Account Managers, Segment Team Leaders, clear understanding of the role in a team should be communicated and practiced.<\u002Fli> \n        <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n       <li>The proper balance must be struck between short term targets (acquisition and commercialization of project opportunities) and longer term Key Customer Account Plan objectives (developing value propositions for future growth, innovating in materials &amp; applications)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>The proper link must be made between market needs and company goals.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>The position requires the ability to work well as a team member across regional and cultural lines.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>The position requires the ability to harvest technical information and data from within the DEP scientific and R&amp;T community, and skillfully interpret and present the information to the Key Customer engineering community at a rapid pace.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Our customer markets are extremely fast moving and dynamic requiring flexibility in work style, schedule, and focus.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Daily contact with customers can be required to support current and future business objectives.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Changing technical demands from DSM, the industry and the customers will need to be managed and addressed.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b>Educational level:<\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Bachelor of Science in Mechanical, Chemical, or Electrical Engineering or related field REQUIRED<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Masters Preferred<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b>Knowledge and required skills:<\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <ul>\n       <li><b>Technical<\u002Fb> \n        <ul>\n         <li>In-depth knowledge of the automotive landscape in engineering thermoplastics<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Plastic part design knowledge (especially for manufacturability)<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Plastic processing and tooling knowledge is a plus<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Six Sigma methodology is a plus<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Interpretation of various CAE packages (Moldflow, FEA, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n        <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n       <li><b>Computer<\u002Fb> \n        <ul>\n         <li>Expert skills in internet technical searches<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Proficiency in Word Processing (i.e. Microsoft Word), Spreadsheets (i.e. Microsoft Excel), and Presentation (i.e. Microsoft PowerPoint) packages<\u002Fli> \n        <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n       <li><b>Professional<\u002Fb> \n        <ul>\n         <li>Customer relationship management<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Organizational skills<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Team orientation<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Speed in responsiveness<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Polished written and verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Comfortable in self-starting or taking direction<\u002Fli> \n         <li>Project leadership skills<\u002Fli>\n        <\u002Ful><br> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <div><\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <b>Required level of experiences<\u002Fb>\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n      <ul>\n       <li>Minimum of 7 years of Application experience in a plastics and\u002For customer application-related discipline<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Demonstrated accomplishment in leading large development or operational projects<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Proven success in large and small cross-function team environment<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <br> \n      <div><\u002Fdiv> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n For more than 30 years, the company has been at the forefront of biomaterial science and process innovation, and the leading resource for global medical device and pharmaceutical companies. As a strategic partner with an approach driven not only by market dynamics but by the unique needs of every customer, DSM Biomedical brings an unparalleled breadth of product portfolios, proprietary manufacturing and processing capabilities, world-class IP, and extensive regulatory experience and expertise. Furthermore, DSM Biomedical’s products and services are recognized for their unmatched quality, consistency, and performance in multiple markets across the globe, supporting their company-wide vision of solving the world’s healthcare needs through sustainable science. The APM is responsible for creating and maintaining the project plan and schedule, owning the project budgets and spending, and is responsible for ensuring that project objectives and milestones are met within time and budget constraints and with appropriate quality.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Will:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Generate project plans and ensure that the project deliverables and milestones are met.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manage projects in terms of money, time, escalating scope changes, resource needs, quality and information\u002Fcommunication.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manage multiple projects or initiatives based on scope, complexity, and timelines. APM projects are less complex or involve lower and narrower levels of the organization.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensure compliance of project team members with DSM Biomedical quality system requirements. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ensure a safe, healthy, and injury-free work environment.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Report the progress of the project versus the project plan.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manage the risks related Office through active participation and contribution toward PMO functional initiatives.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Manage external party expectations including those of the customer.<\u002Fli> \n organizes, interprets and documents scientific information and data to support product and claims development for existing and future products for microbiome and probiotic categories.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Contributes to the communication of complex scientific information cross-functionally to deliver consistent, scientifically supported, and approved claims and messages for microbiome and probiotic categories.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provide critical support for product development initiatives for microbiome and probiotic categories and manage cross-functional projects on an as-needed basis. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Partner with marketing to develop innovation strategies across company portfolio for microbiome and probiotic categories by contributing to the full assessment of scientific landscape, identifying differentiating claims and positioning for new products.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Liaison to Regulatory department for microbiome and probiotic categories. Supports regulatory and legal functions as needed by communicating scientific evidence, offering insight with respect to claims language.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You bring<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Master’s degree in Nutritional Sciences, Life Sciences or Biochemistry field. Candidates with a B.S. and considerable experience in the probiotic dietary supplement industry may be considered.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A minimum of 5 years of experience (Master’s Degree) or 8 years of experience (Bachelor’s Degree) in interpreting basic science and clinical research. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Working and applied scientific knowledge of the gut microbiome, and the ability to identify and interpret relevant clinical trials.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Fluent and proficient abilities to search scientific databases for relevant literature and patents.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Published in peer review journal(s) and previous experience contributing to scientific research within the Food\u002F Supplement\u002F Biotechnology\u002FPharmaceutical areas in industry or academia.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Previous experience contributing to scientific research within the Food\u002F Supplement\u002F Biotechnology\u002FPharmaceutical areas in industry or academia<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Scientific Affairs experience and familiarity with external environment impacting scientific claims is desirable.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Some combination of training and experience within the following is desirable: FDA dietary supplement regulation knowledge. Physiology\u002FBiochemistry\u002FPharmacology\u002FBiology\u002FMicrobiology. Food\u002FNutraceutical\u002FPharmaceutical industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About Research &amp; Development<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Our Innovation, Research &amp; Development team propels our business into the future, with new discoveries at every corner. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM es una empresa global, “purpose-led”, con base científica y activa en los campos de la nutrición, la salud y la vida sostenible. El propósito de DSM es crear vidas más brillantes para todos. DSM afronta con sus productos y soluciones algunos de los retos mundiales actuales más importantes, a la vez que logra prosperidad económica y valor medioambiental y social para todas las partes interesadas (clientes, empleados, accionistas y la sociedad en general). DSM ofrece soluciones innovadoras para la nutrición humana y animal, higiene personal y fragancias, productos sanitarios, productos ecológicos y aplicaciones, y nueva movilidad y conectividad. DSM y sus empresas asociadas arrojan un volumen de ventas netas anual de aproximadamente 10 000 millones de euros y cuentan con unos 23.000 empleados. La empresa se fundó en 1902 y cotiza en Euronext Ámsterdam. Más información en www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <p><b>Auxiliar de Producción<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El reto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Ejecutar todas aquellas actividades operativas que se realizar durante el proceso de fabricación de premezclas en la planta de ANH, operando adecuadamente los equipos y los materiales relacionados y correspondientes a su puesto, siguiendo los procedimientos, guías y políticas establecidos en los aspectos de procesos, calidad, seguridad e higiene lo cual nos permita cumplir con los productos en tiempo, calidad y cantidad y así satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes internos y externos, reportando oportunamente cualquier anomalía detectada.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La posición:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Operar los equipos que correspondan y el manejo adecuado de los materiales, de acuerdo al nivel de certificación que mantenga, siguiendo los procedimientos y guías de calidad establecidos para cada puesto de Producción ANH; para con esto dar cumplimiento al Sistema de Calidad y el uso eficiente de los recursos que se tienen asignados.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Cumplir con los procesos de capacitación y certificación como operador multifunción de producción ANH, siguiendo los pasos en el procedimiento para tal fin para de esta forma ir certificando cada uno de los puestos y niveles definidos y finalmente certificarse como operador multifunción.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Desempeñar las actividades operativas de producción de manera segura e higiénica y siguiendo medida que promuevan la protección del ambiente cumpliendo las políticas y medidas establecidas y otras medidas y acciones que promuevan el Departamento de Seguridad e Higiene, Protección Ambiental y Recursos Humanos, para así reducir riesgos que afecten a las personas, a la compañía y al medio habiente.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Trabajar siguiendo lo establecido en nuestro Sistema de Calidad, dando cumplimiento a los requisitos de Calidad establecidos en cada uno de los puestos, para de esta forma asegurar la calidad de los productos que se fabriquen.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Cuidar y mantener en óptimas condiciones de trabajo los equipos asignados para su operación, siguiendo los procedimientos de operación y de limpieza de las áreas, apoyados por el personal de mantenimiento y la supervisión, para así evitar paros de la operación y prolongar la vida útil de los equipos asignados.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Solicitar al supervisor de producción la creación de una Notificación de Trabajo cuando se detecte un problema de mantenimiento.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conducirse en todo momento con respeto y disciplina, hacia sus compañeros y superiores; dando cumplimiento al Reglamento Interior de Trabajo de la empresa.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El ideal:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Preparatoria terminada<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experiencia previa en el área de producción de empresas de manufactura del giro de alimentos o farmaceuticos<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Disponibilidad para rolar turnos<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conocimientos de Buenas practicas de manufactura, reglamentos de seguridad y normas de calidad en la proucción.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La Compensación:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Trabajar para DSM significa una oportunidad de contribuir realmente a mejorar la vida de las personas resolviendo los retos presentes en el mundo de hoy. Trabajos desafiantes, oportunidades de crecimiento y un ambiente inspirador permiten que puedas alcanzar tu desarrollo personal. DSM reconoce que el éxito continuo de una compañía depende del desarrollo frecuente y compromiso de nuestros colaboradores buscando una política de remuneración justa y competitiva, reconociendo las competencias y desempeño individual y del equipo.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>Procedimiento y Contacto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   ¿Estas interesado en esta posición por favor aplica en linea a través del portal de carreras (www.dsm.com\u002Fcareers).\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM es un empleador que promueve la igualdad de oportunidades y la discriminación positiva, y todos los solicitantes cualificados serán considerados para el puesto sin distinción de raza, color, religión, sexo, nación de origen, edad, estado de veterano protegido, estado de persona cualificada con una discapacidad o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM es una empresa global, “purpose-led”, con base científica y activa en los campos de la nutrición, la salud y la vida sostenible. El propósito de DSM es crear vidas más brillantes para todos. DSM afronta con sus productos y soluciones algunos de los retos mundiales actuales más importantes, a la vez que logra prosperidad económica y valor medioambiental y social para todas las partes interesadas (clientes, empleados, accionistas y la sociedad en general). DSM ofrece soluciones innovadoras para la nutrición humana y animal, higiene personal y fragancias, productos sanitarios, productos ecológicos y aplicaciones, y nueva movilidad y conectividad. DSM y sus empresas asociadas arrojan un volumen de ventas netas anual de aproximadamente 10 000 millones de euros y cuentan con unos 23.000 empleados. La empresa se fundó en 1902 y cotiza en Euronext Ámsterdam. Más información en www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <p><b>Operador de Producción<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El reto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Ejecutar todas aquellas actividades operativas que se realizar durante el proceso de fabricación de premezclas en la planta de ANH, operando adecuadamente los equipos y los materiales relacionados y correspondientes a su puesto, siguiendo los procedimientos, guías y políticas establecidos en los aspectos de procesos, calidad, seguridad e higiene lo cual nos permita cumplir con los productos en tiempo, calidad y cantidad y así satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes internos y externos, reportando oportunamente cualquier anomalía detectada.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La posición:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Operar los equipos que correspondan y el manejo adecuado de los materiales, de acuerdo al nivel de certificación que mantenga, siguiendo los procedimientos y guías de calidad establecidos para cada puesto de Producción ANH; para con esto dar cumplimiento al Sistema de Calidad y el uso eficiente de los recursos que se tienen asignados.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Cumplir con los procesos de capacitación y certificación como operador multifunción de producción ANH, siguiendo los pasos en el procedimiento para tal fin para de esta forma ir certificando cada uno de los puestos y niveles definidos y finalmente certificarse como operador multifunción.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Desempeñar las actividades operativas de producción de manera segura e higiénica y siguiendo medida que promuevan la protección del ambiente cumpliendo las políticas y medidas establecidas y otras medidas y acciones que promuevan el Departamento de Seguridad e Higiene, Protección Ambiental y Recursos Humanos, para así reducir riesgos que afecten a las personas, a la compañía y al medio habiente.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Trabajar siguiendo lo establecido en nuestro Sistema de Calidad, dando cumplimiento a los requisitos de Calidad establecidos en cada uno de los puestos, para de esta forma asegurar la calidad de los productos que se fabriquen.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Cuidar y mantener en óptimas condiciones de trabajo los equipos asignados para su operación, siguiendo los procedimientos de operación y de limpieza de las áreas, apoyados por el personal de mantenimiento y la supervisión, para así evitar paros de la operación y prolongar la vida útil de los equipos asignados.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Solicitar al supervisor de producción la creación de una Notificación de Trabajo cuando se detecte un problema de mantenimiento.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conducirse en todo momento con respeto y disciplina, hacia sus compañeros y superiores; dando cumplimiento al Reglamento Interior de Trabajo de la empresa.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El ideal:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Preparatoria terminada<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experiencia previa en el área de producción de empresas de manufactura del giro de alimentos o farmaceuticos<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Disponibilidad para rolar turnos<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conocimientos de Buenas practicas de manufactura, reglamentos de seguridad y normas de calidad en la proucción.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La Compensación:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Trabajar para DSM significa una oportunidad de contribuir realmente a mejorar la vida de las personas resolviendo los retos presentes en el mundo de hoy. Trabajos desafiantes, oportunidades de crecimiento y un ambiente inspirador permiten que puedas alcanzar tu desarrollo personal. DSM reconoce que el éxito continuo de una compañía depende del desarrollo frecuente y compromiso de nuestros colaboradores buscando una política de remuneración justa y competitiva, reconociendo las competencias y desempeño individual y del equipo.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>Procedimiento y Contacto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   ¿Estas interesado en esta posición por favor aplica en linea a través del portal de carreras (www.dsm.com\u002Fcareers).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM es un empleador que promueve la igualdad de oportunidades y la discriminación positiva, y todos los solicitantes cualificados serán considerados para el puesto sin distinción de raza, color, religión, sexo, nación de origen, edad, estado de veterano protegido, estado de persona cualificada con una discapacidad o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM es una empresa global, “purpose-led”, con base científica y activa en los campos de la nutrición, la salud y la vida sostenible. El propósito de DSM es crear vidas más brillantes para todos. DSM afronta con sus productos y soluciones algunos de los retos mundiales actuales más importantes, a la vez que logra prosperidad económica y valor medioambiental y social para todas las partes interesadas (clientes, empleados, accionistas y la sociedad en general). DSM ofrece soluciones innovadoras para la nutrición humana y animal, higiene personal y fragancias, productos sanitarios, productos ecológicos y aplicaciones, y nueva movilidad y conectividad. DSM y sus empresas asociadas arrojan un volumen de ventas netas anual de aproximadamente 10 000 millones de euros y cuentan con unos 23.000 empleados. La empresa se fundó en 1902 y cotiza en Euronext Ámsterdam. Más información en www.dsm.com.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <p><b>Operador de Producción<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El reto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Ejecutar todas aquellas actividades operativas que se realizar durante el proceso de fabricación de premezclas en la planta de ANH, operando adecuadamente los equipos y los materiales relacionados y correspondientes a su puesto, siguiendo los procedimientos, guías y políticas establecidos en los aspectos de procesos, calidad, seguridad e higiene lo cual nos permita cumplir con los productos en tiempo, calidad y cantidad y así satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes internos y externos, reportando oportunamente cualquier anomalía detectada.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La posición:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Operar los equipos que correspondan y el manejo adecuado de los materiales, de acuerdo al nivel de certificación que mantenga, siguiendo los procedimientos y guías de calidad establecidos para cada puesto de Producción ANH; para con esto dar cumplimiento al Sistema de Calidad y el uso eficiente de los recursos que se tienen asignados.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Cumplir con los procesos de capacitación y certificación como operador multifunción de producción ANH, siguiendo los pasos en el procedimiento para tal fin para de esta forma ir certificando cada uno de los puestos y niveles definidos y finalmente certificarse como operador multifunción.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Desempeñar las actividades operativas de producción de manera segura e higiénica y siguiendo medida que promuevan la protección del ambiente cumpliendo las políticas y medidas establecidas y otras medidas y acciones que promuevan el Departamento de Seguridad e Higiene, Protección Ambiental y Recursos Humanos, para así reducir riesgos que afecten a las personas, a la compañía y al medio habiente.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Trabajar siguiendo lo establecido en nuestro Sistema de Calidad, dando cumplimiento a los requisitos de Calidad establecidos en cada uno de los puestos, para de esta forma asegurar la calidad de los productos que se fabriquen.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Cuidar y mantener en óptimas condiciones de trabajo los equipos asignados para su operación, siguiendo los procedimientos de operación y de limpieza de las áreas, apoyados por el personal de mantenimiento y la supervisión, para así evitar paros de la operación y prolongar la vida útil de los equipos asignados.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Solicitar al supervisor de producción la creación de una Notificación de Trabajo cuando se detecte un problema de mantenimiento.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conducirse en todo momento con respeto y disciplina, hacia sus compañeros y superiores; dando cumplimiento al Reglamento Interior de Trabajo de la empresa.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>El ideal:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Preparatoria terminada<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experiencia previa en el área de producción de empresas de manufactura del giro de alimentos o farmaceuticos<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Disponibilidad para rolar turnos<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Conocimientos de Buenas practicas de manufactura, reglamentos de seguridad y normas de calidad en la proucción.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>La Compensación:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   Trabajar para DSM significa una oportunidad de contribuir realmente a mejorar la vida de las personas resolviendo los retos presentes en el mundo de hoy. Trabajos desafiantes, oportunidades de crecimiento y un ambiente inspirador permiten que puedas alcanzar tu desarrollo personal. DSM reconoce que el éxito continuo de una compañía depende del desarrollo frecuente y compromiso de nuestros colaboradores buscando una política de remuneración justa y competitiva, reconociendo las competencias y desempeño individual y del equipo.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><b>Procedimiento y Contacto:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <div>\n   ¿Estas interesado en esta posición por favor aplica en linea a través del portal de carreras (www.dsm.com\u002Fcareers).\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM es un empleador que promueve la igualdad de oportunidades y la discriminación positiva, y todos los solicitantes cualificados serán considerados para el puesto sin distinción de raza, color, religión, sexo, nación de origen, edad, estado de veterano protegido, estado de persona cualificada con una discapacidad o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n Our materials enable lighter, stronger and more durable products – which in turn makes people’s lives safer, more convenient and healthier – and all while helping to tackle carbon emissions.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Perhaps the greatest trend driving our markets is the move towards mobility and connectivity – on the road, in the home and office, and on the street. We’re seeing new standards in design and usability coupled with our planet’s pressing need to cut energy use and avoid waste through circular design thinking.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Take ‘thinovation’ – the trend for creating smaller, lighter, greener and safer working parts in electronic devices. Today, our materials are used to create components like the tiny connectors that give mobile phones their incredible functionality.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   There’s more available on the\n   <b> DSM Engineering Materials<\u002Fb> business here:\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   https:\u002F\u002Fwww.dsm.com\u002Fmarkets\u002Fengineering-materials\u002Fen.html\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. For critical equipment and perform Failure Mode &amp; Effect Analysis (FMEA).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Translate PPM plan into specific preventive maintenance activities and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Identify and prioritize performance issues and cost drivers related to equipment reliability by evaluating the performance of the plant in terms of OEE, using statistical methods, RCA (Root Cause Analysis) and FMEA (Failure Mode &amp; Effect Analysis).<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Propose and initiate technical solutions to eliminate actual and potential performance issues and discuss with stakeholders (maintenance, production, business, etc.). Ensure handover to appropriate work process. Safeguard the availability of critical and other spare parts for the plant.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Ensure compliance with site management of change procedure for Improve Plant proposals that have been allocated to him\u002Fher.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Translate BG \u002F Plant Management objectives into a Preventive &amp; Predictive Maintenance Plan (PPM), in cooperation with maintenance management. Continuously develop and optimize the PPM plan, achieving maximum availability of the plant against the lowest costs.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Supports plant and corporate initiatives as outlined in the manufacturing plan. Follows key operational excellence element and Manufacturing Excellence to optimize how we do things. Manufacturing Excellence is key to ensure processes are followed and linked with key stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Superior advisory, communication, social skills, safely practices and accountability.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Bachelors\u002FMasters in an Engineering discipline -Mechanical Engineer preferred.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Minimum of 3 years’ experience is required.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Detailed knowledge of relevant work processes such as Improve Equipment Reliability and Maintenance and overall understanding of production environment processes.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Skilled utilizing relevant practices such as FMEA, RCA, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>About Manufacturing:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   With DSM Nutritional Product sites consistently proving that we have some of the best facilities in the world, it’s obvious that the Manufacturing team doesn’t just talk about sustainability. We live it in everything we do. <div>\n  <div>\n   <b>Bring your passion. practices, safe operating windows and corporate requirements (SHE, Manufacturing, Finance) and cGMP standards.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Responsible for the effective and efficient allocation of the Improve Plant Department Operational Expense Budget. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Execute feasibility studies and plant trials in support of plant problems, opportunities, product development and technological innovations. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Develop and lead projects within the Improve Plant Work Process and ensure handover to appropriate work process. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Monitor progress of a project against milestones or deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>We Bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>A competitive compensation package, with comprehensive health and welfare benefits.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A place to grow and develop.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>A company that is purpose-led and performance-driven in a corporate culture that values people and planet.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The opportunity to work on growing brands and build on a strong foundation.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>The chance to make improvements and make an impact on the business.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b>You Bring:<\u002Fb>\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <ul>\n   <li>BS Degree in an engineering or (Bio) Chemical discipline. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>3+ years of manufacturing experience in various aspects of process control, automation engineering including various DCS and PLC systems.<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Experience in Automation and Process Control is essential. We live it in everything we do. From large solar fields to biomass cogeneration plants, we put green electricity back into local grids while producing the high-quality products and solutions our customers need. global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is A rewarding role that will keep you on the move<\u002Fp>\n<p>As a Production Operator in our Germantown plant, you will be part of a hard-working, welcoming team that manufactures specialty ingredients and processing aids for the dairy industry<\u002Fp>\n<p>The Germantown plant is a 24-hour-a-day, 5-days-a-week operation manufacturing Direct Vat Cultures (DVC) and Bulk Set Cultures (BSC) used in making cheese and other dairy products.<\u002Fp>\n<p>Our foundation starts with safety, and the health and well-being of our team is truly our number one priority. Within our different production areas, your activities could involve preparing, initiating and monitoring fermentation processes, or subsequent functions including blending and packaging. You will be guided by leaders who will listen to your opinions and feedback to create the best working environment for everyone in the team, every step of the way. Completes appropriate documentation.<\u002Fp>\n<p><b>Your key responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>Acts in such a way that safety awareness and accident prevention are considered in performing all tasks.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Works to SHE standards and encourages fellow colleagues to work to the same standards.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Operates process and utility equipment in a hygienic and safe manner in accordance with all process procedures, cGMP, HAACP and SHE instructions and guidelines. Acts in such a way that safety awareness and accident prevention are considered in the performance of all tasks.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Sets up, calibrates, and monitors instruments, i.e., pH meter, temperature meter, conductivity meter, hydrometer, thermometers, and metal detection devices.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Tears down, cleans and re-assembles equipment, i.e., pumps, mills, grinders, valves, etc. Clean utensils, vessels, and lines.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Identifies, troubleshoots, and responds to deviations in process, product, equipment, and performance variations.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Sets up recipes and\u002For standard operating procedures (SOP’s), understands and executes operations in mixing, pH adjustment, transfers and process sequences while documenting steps and other records.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Identifies and takes appropriate action for variations in raw materials, foreign debris, color changes, smell, moisture, and temperature variations.<\u002Fli>\n<\u002Ful>\n<p><b>What you bring<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>High school diploma or equivalent AND 2 years site production experience<\u002Fli>\n <li>Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written<\u002Fli>\n <li>Knowledge to perform responsibilities with minimal guidance<\u002Fli>\n <li>Forklift driver certification<\u002Fli>\n <li>Proficiency in basic IT tools (e.g. MS office)<\u002Fli>\n <li>Ability to perform the physical requirements of assigned duties.<\u002Fli>\n<\u002Ful>\n<p><b>How to apply<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<p>Interested in this position? #hiring at DSM for: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<p><b>Senior Production Operator<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<p><b>Location: Naperville, IL<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<p><i>It is a 12-hour rotating shift (5 AM to 5 PM and 5 PM – 5 AM).<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n<p><b>What you'll do: <\u002Fb><br>As a Senior Production Operator, you have a business-critical role. You will perform all production activities and operate production equipment in accordance with the plant capacity and in conformity with SHE requirements, SOPs, Quality standards, and time sequences. As well as all duties associated with analyzing samples, making process decisions, and performing and scheduling minor maintenance repairs.<br>The Naperville, IL manufacturing plant offers support to the development of a more sustainable global production industry.<\u002Fp>\n<p><b>We bring: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>A competitive compensation package, with comprehensive health and welfare benefits<\u002Fli>\n <li>A place to grow and develop<\u002Fli>\n <li>A company that is purpose-led and performance-driven in a corporate culture that values people and planet<\u002Fli>\n <li>The opportunity to work on growing brands and build on a strong foundation<\u002Fli>\n <li>The chance to make improvements and make an impact on the business<\u002Fli>\n<\u002Ful>\n<p><b>Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>Handle raw materials from receiving to the production storage area to the plant area and add them into the process reactors according to the SOP or Production Supervisor instruction.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Monitor equipment and process parameters, and take actions necessary to maintain process in control<\u002Fli>\n <li>Record process parameters in the batch records according to the time schedule and sign the batch sheet<\u002Fli>\n <li>Take samples, analyze using HPLC and interpret results and make process decisions when relevant<\u002Fli>\n <li>Perform minor maintenance tasks in accordance with the appropriate SHE guidelines and using SOP’s where applicable and within individual competency<\u002Fli>\n<\u002Ful>\n<p><b>You bring: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>High School diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n <li>1-4 years of experience in the production environment<\u002Fli>\n <li>Ability to work in a team environment, rotating shifts, and coordinate multiple resources without direct supervision.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Ability to operate personal computers; familiar with spreadsheets and word documents.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Ability to lift 50 lbs and move 55 gallon drums using a drum cart.<\u002Fli>\n<\u002Ful>\n<p><b>How to apply<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<p>Interested in this position? your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb><br><b>SHE Professional<\u002Fb><br><b>Location: Germantown, WI<\u002Fb><br><b>What You’ll Do: <\u002Fb><br>As a <b>SHE Professional<\u002Fb>, you will be responsible for the ongoing development and continuous improvement of the Safety, Health, and Environment (SHE) program for First Choice a division of DSM. To be successful, the SHE Officer shall establish, maintain, and leverage strong relationships with people at all levels and functions at the site.<br><b>Your Key Responsibilities: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>Provide guidance and technical support regarding regulatory questions.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Develop site safety training programs for employees which include home safety programs.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Developing site SHE culture development initiatives, where appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Write and update site SHE SOPs as needed due to changing operational environmental\u002Factivities and or corporate requirements.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Investigation of incidents\u002Faccidents to ascertain causes and recommendations for preventive measures.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Review outside construction, professional and outsourced contractor’s safety records, programs, licenses and training programs. Conduct contractor construction audits to ensure Compliance with legislation and DSM standards.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Provides guidance and direction in the areas of Safety &amp; Health for the site.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Audits Safety and Health programs\u002Fprocesses to ensure compliance with site\u002Fcompany\u002Fdivision and government regulations or standards and\u002For SOPs.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Conducts improvement activities for the site safety and industrial hygiene and serves as an expert to the organization.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Provide guidance and support which ensures compliance for the safe work permitting (e.g., hot-work, confined space entry, lock-out tag-out hazardous material) process, including writing and issuing permits. Auditing all documents related to the permits.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Maintain site wide chemical inventory data and electronic MSDS database. Also, maintain a current list of chemicals used onsite.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Involvement in setting up &amp; reviewing SHEQ requirements, procedures, and instructions by participating in SHEQ culture on site.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Ownership of site training programs and maintenance of personnel training matrixes<\u002Fli>\n <li>All employees are expected to be aware of and follow all DSM Life Saving Rules.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Acts in such a way that safety awareness &amp; accident prevention are considered in performing all tasks.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Shows leadership by working to SHEQ standards and encouraging employees to work to the same standards.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Coordinate with HR department to ensure timely and appropriate medical care is provided and a return-to-work plan developed.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Ability to lead or participate in incident investigations include root cause failure analysis.<\u002Fli>\n<\u002Ful>\n<p><b>You Bring: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>5 years of experience in a related progressively responsible professional in a manufacturing or industrial setting.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Post-secondary education in a related field, such as public\u002Foccupational health and safety is an asset.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Must have demonstrated knowledge of all applicable safety and industrial hygiene regulations and experience in auditing compliance thereto.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Practical experience in health, safety and environmental areas including lockout tagout tryout, work at heights, lifting and hoisting, inspections and audits of the safety program, root cause analysis, Hazard, and Operability Analysis (HAZOP) studies, health risk assessment, risk reduction training, industrial hygiene, etc.<\u002Fli>\n <li>High level of conceptual and analytical thinking.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Good knowledge of SHE strategies, policies, practices, and regulations.<\u002Fli>\n<\u002Ful>\n<p><b>DSM Food Specialties<\u002Fb> is a leading global supplier of food enzymes, cultures, taste and health ingredients and other specialties for the many of the leading global and local dairy, baking, beverages, and savory food brands. Our advanced ingredients help our customers to differentiate their products with great taste, texture and appearance and optimize their production processes by reducing raw material usage, waste, emissions, and energy need. Over 400 of our scientists are committed each day to find new science-based innovations, building on more than a hundred years’ experience in enzyme and fermentation technology. Our people are driven by optimism – a belief that through innovations in food technology, solutions are possible and actionable and many of our customers involve us closely in their product development and production process to help them solve challenges by combining the possibilities of science with our dedication and application knowledge.<br><b>How to Apply: <\u002Fb><br>Interested in this position? You will also perform\u002FApply knowledge and skills to diverse and complex reactions. In this role, you will also release testing of products according to current compendia, regulatory and corporate quality systems, and principles.<br><b>What we bring<\u002Fb><br>Working for DSM means the opportunity to really contribute to improve people’s lives and solving the challenges of today’s world. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. your passion. Build the future.<\u002Fb><br><b>SHE Specialist<\u002Fb><br><b>Location: Germantown, WI<\u002Fb><br><b>What You’ll Do: <\u002Fb><br>As a <b>SHE Specialist<\u002Fb>, you will support dedicated elements of the site SHE &amp; Security policy and annual and long-term plans, in compliance with corporate requirements and relevant laws and regulations. The general scope of the position includes conducting employee training, conducting safety observations, coaching employees, generating reports, maintaining records and writing procedures.<br><b>What we bring: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>An organization where we care for our people and find a safe and inclusive environment of the utmost importance<\u002Fli>\n <li>A dynamic workplace where you get the opportunity to shape and use your creativity to come with solutions that have a direct impact on the business<\u002Fli>\n <li>A possibility to work in a global setting and team with different cultures and dynamics<\u002Fli>\n <li>A learning environment where you can develop yourself and your team to the next level.<\u002Fli>\n<\u002Ful>\n<p><b>Your Key Responsibilities: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>Examines plans and specifications for new machinery or equipment to determine if all safety precautions have been included.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Tours work areas to inspect fire and safety equipment, machinery, and facilities to identify and correct potential hazards and ensure compliance with safety regulations.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Conducts or coordinates Safety, Health and Environmental (SHE) training to educate workers about safety policies, laws, and practices.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Investigates industrial accidents to minimize recurrence and prepares accident reports.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Aware of and follows all DSM Life Saving Rules.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Acts in such a way that safety awareness and accident prevention are considered in performing all tasks.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Prepare and provide SHE training and instructions, including coordinating and\u002For conducting new hire safety training and monthly safety training to educate employees about safety policies, laws and practices.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Advise management and employees on SHE issues and set an example. Effectively coach and develop operations line supervision to be effective SHE leaders\u002Fcoaches in their respective roles.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Participate in incident investigations (root cause analyses) to minimize recurrence and prepares accident reports.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Actively participate in regular site internal inspections.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Accompany internal and external auditors and provide the required information and explanations<\u002Fli>\n <li>Drive Excellence through active participation on the production floor to adopt a zero-tolerance mentality toward SHE losses.<\u002Fli>\n<\u002Ful>\n<p><b>You Bring: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>Associate degree in a safety or related field from an accredited institution OR High School Diploma with relevant work experience OR OSHA-accredited training with relevant work experience<\u002Fli>\n <li>Basic knowledge of federal and state regulations pertaining to Safety, Health &amp; Environment, such as EPA, DOT, NFPA, OSHA and NIOSH<\u002Fli>\n <li>Strong communication skills; must be able to effectively communicate technical issues to a diverse organization<\u002Fli>\n <li>Strong organizational and time management skills<\u002Fli>\n <li>Ability to satisfactorily manage and report status of assignments, tasks, responsibilities, and multiple elements of complex programs<\u002Fli>\n<\u002Ful>\n<p><b>DSM Food Specialties<\u002Fb> is a leading global supplier of food enzymes, cultures, taste and health ingredients and other specialties for the many of the leading global and local dairy, baking, beverages, and savory food brands. Our advanced ingredients help our customers to differentiate their products with great taste, texture and appearance and optimize their production processes by reducing raw material usage, waste, emissions, and energy need. Over 400 of our scientists are committed each day to find new science-based innovations, building on more than a hundred years’ experience in enzyme and fermentation technology. Our people are driven by optimism – a belief that through innovations in food technology, solutions are possible and actionable and many of our customers involve us closely in their product development and production process to help them solve challenges by combining the possibilities of science with our dedication and application knowledge.<br><b>How to Apply: <\u002Fb><br>Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by uploading your resume in English via our career portal https:\u002F\u002Fcareers.dsm.com\u002F. The procedure will generally be in line with the DSM application process outlined on the DSM career website. Due to privacy regulations, we can only actively interact with applications via our career portal.<br>Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and<br>affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.<\u002Fp>\n<p>Job Type: Here’s your chance. Play your part as a Manufacturing Operator at DSM.<\u002Fp>\n<p>Welcome to the manufacturing team at the DSM Schenectady plant. As a key part of a diverse workforce, you’ll work our 1st, 2nd or 3rd (plus shift differential) shifts and play an important role in the plant’s day-to-day operations. This is a physical role with a lot of variety where you’ll enjoy collaborating with your coworkers to make what we do, and how we do it, even better. This will involve handling raw materials (dry pre-mix powders) of up to 55lbs, monitoring equipment and processes, analyzing our products, and carrying out minor maintenance tasks. You’ll be supported by leaders who will listen to your opinions and, with your help, create the best working environment for everyone in the team. Take the opportunity to show us what you can do, and you can count on progression and growth within the business.<\u002Fp>\n<p>The work you do will directly impact the quality of our products and help improve real lives. Step up, share your experience and shape our future.<\u002Fp>\n<p>Starting pay is $21.00 per hour ($0.50\u002F hr. for 2nd shift and $1.75\u002Fhr. for 3rd shift) PLUS you’ll receive a $2000 sign-on Build the future.<\u002Fb><br><b>We are #hiring at DSM: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<p><b>Quality Control Lab Technician (2nd Shift)<\u002Fb><br><b>Location: South Bend, IN<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<p><b>What you’ll do<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<p>The primary responsibility of a <b>Quality Control Lab Technician<\u002Fb> is to ensure products meet or exceed customer requirements for quality and food safety. This role will be responsible for the analysis of raw materials, intermediates, and finished products manufactured or received in South Bend with an emphasis on standard operating procedures and good laboratory practices.<\u002Fp>\n<p><b>What we bring<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<p>Working for DSM means the opportunity to really contribute to improve people’s lives and solving the challenges of today’s world. Challenging jobs, career opportunities and an inspiring environment allow you to enhance your personal development. DSM recognizes that the on-going success of the company depends on the continued development and engagement of our employees and pursues a fair and competitive remuneration policy, recognizing individual and team competencies and performance.<\u002Fp>\n<p><b>Your key responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>Analytical laboratories are part of the site QC infrastructure.<\u002Fli>\n <li>The major task is to run the full set of analysis according to validated methods or to support scientists in development and validation of methods.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Main partners are colleagues in the production &amp; shipping dept units and QA staff within the site.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Supports local production, shipping\u002Freceiving and quality control to ensure Quality System requirements (ISO, GMP, HACCP, etc.) are maintained.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Support for analytical questions and troubleshoot instrumentation issues.<\u002Fli>\n <li>With increasing experience, member in quality projects supporting production \u002F quality with method development protocols and validation reports.<\u002Fli>\n<\u002Ful>\n<p><b>You bring<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>Bachelor’s degree preferred, not required.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Minimum of 1 year of prior relevant experience preferred but not required.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Knowledge of quality systems &amp; GMP programs.<\u002Fli>\n <li>Good analytical skills and attention to details are important.<\u002Fli>\n<\u002Ful>\n<p><b>About Quality<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<p>No matter which team you are on, at DSM you’ll be part of a powerful shared purpose – to create brighter lives for all. You’ll get opportunities to work collaboratively with different departments and industry experts to make a positive difference to the future of millions of people and the planet we all share. Together, we’ll understand the needs of every customer and offer solutions that promote their success and impact, today and in the future.<\u002Fp>\n<p><b>How to apply<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<p>Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by uploading your resume in English via our career portal. The procedure will generally be in line with the DSM application process outlined on the DSM career website. applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability,
